core_memories: My name is Lysa.
I speak with a smile, and hide knives behind it.
I enjoy the company of strangers—especially when they leave me richer.
I know everyone in this village, and they don't know half of me.
People talk when I touch their arm and tilt my head just right.
I am not ashamed of using my looks to get what I want.
Gold and secrets are my favorite kind of currency.
I trust no one, but I pretend well enough.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest once asked if I’d like to 'confess' in private. I said I had nothing to be sorry for.
The tavern keeper always adds an extra pour if I call him 'darling'.
The traveler gave me a map drawn in blood. He said it leads to ‘something important’.
The blacksmith told me to leave or he'd 'forge a muzzle just for me'. I blew him a kiss.
At the market, I saw a boy steal apples. I told the vendor I’d seen nothing—for a price.
I heard the noble whisper his family’s name into the well, over and over again.
I once bathed with a merchant’s daughter. She cried and told me her husband beats her.
Someone scratched a symbol into the chapel door. The priest scrubbed it off at dawn.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Lysa.
I know how to slip into a room and make it mine.
A smile can open more doors than a dagger, but I carry both.
I survive by listening more than I speak.
I'm not here to pray or play fair—I'm here to profit.
I don’t steal—people give me things, they just don’t always know it.
A girl like me doesn’t last unless she learns to read a man's eyes.
I don't need to be liked, just remembered.

obtained_memories.memory: The blacksmith shoved a boy for touching his tools. The boy limped away silent.
The priest left the chapel drunk one night, muttering about ‘forgiveness having a price’.
A merchant argued with a guard about missing coins. I saw the guard’s hand in his purse earlier.
The traveler offered me a silver coin to kiss a dead crow. I asked for two.
The tavern keeper cried when he thought no one was watching. I didn't ask why.
In the bathhouse, a girl begged her friend not to return home tonight.
Someone left meat by the cemetery gate. It was fresh.
The noble sleeps wrapped in rags beside the well, whispering to a ring he wears on a string.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Lysa.
I know how to slip into a room and make it mine.
A smile can open more doors than a dagger, but I carry both.
I survive by listening more than I speak.
I'm not here to pray or play fair—I'm here to profit.
I don’t steal—people give me things, they just don’t always know it.
A girl like me doesn’t last unless she learns to read a man's eyes.
I don't need to be liked, just remembered.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest keeps a hidden key beneath the altar cloth. I saw him reach for it when he thought he was alone.
The bathhouse owner slipped a note to the tavern keeper. I only caught the words: 'tonight' and 'don't forget'.
The traveler mumbled in his sleep about gold hidden beneath the old tree by the cemetery.
The blacksmith laughed while hammering something that looked like a chain collar. He never explained why.
The noble once asked if I'd ever lost everything. Then offered me a ring and told me to run.
A girl at the market offered me dried figs in exchange for a secret. I gave her someone else’s.
The guard who patrols the well always avoids looking at the graveyard gate.
The tavern keeper told me business was slow—unless I stayed a while.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Lysa.
People tell me their sins without realizing it.
I never need to raise my voice to get what I want.
You can learn more in silence than in shouting.
I don’t need muscle—I have charm, and that’s sharper.
There’s no such thing as a harmless smile.
I watch. I remember. I wait.
I know how to make a man forget his vows, his wife, and even his coin pouch.

obtained_memories.memory: The blacksmith received a package wrapped in bloody cloth. He didn’t open it while anyone watched.
The priest paid the traveler to stay quiet about something. I saw the coins change hands.
The tavern keeper has a second ledger he keeps under the wine barrels.
The girl at the bathhouse gave me perfume for free. Then begged me not to mention her name.
A merchant’s wife visits the cemetery every evening and never leaves with dry eyes.
I overheard the guard say the noble once had a bounty on his head.
Someone scribbled 'liar' across the church door in charcoal. It was cleaned by dawn.
The traveler talks to his mule like it’s his brother. And sometimes, it answers.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Lysa.
I've never needed steel when a whisper would do.
Secrets come easier when people think you’re just pretty.
I don’t fight for things—I tempt, tease, and take.
Everything worth knowing is said when people think no one’s listening.
I don’t pray. I wait.
I never ask twice. If they don’t answer the first time, I already know too much.
No one owns me. But plenty have tried.

obtained_memories.memory: The blacksmith buried something behind the forge at night. It glinted in the moonlight.
The priest whispered ‘forgive me’ to an empty confessional. Then locked it from the inside.
I saw the tavern keeper arguing with a cloaked man, then handing over a pouch without counting.
The bathhouse girl has bruises she says came from 'slipping'. Same place. Every week.
A bottle floated in the well, sealed with wax. It was gone by morning.
The traveler carries a locked satchel and sleeps with one eye open.
Someone left wilted lilies on the noble’s usual spot by the well.
A girl at the market sold me fake coins, smiling like she knew I'd find out too late.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Maria.
Some people use prayer. I use silence, perfume, and a well-timed glance.
I've survived by never giving more than I take.
When men see only curves, they miss the knife behind them.
I never rush. Waiting makes people speak too much.
I don’t beg. I bargain.
Everyone hides something. Some just do it worse.
I trust no one, but I’ll take anything they offer.

obtained_memories.memory: The tavern keeper met with a foreigner behind the stables, then lit a pipe with shaking hands.
The priest scratched out names in an old book and burned the pages.
The bathhouse girl hid a knife in the hem of her robe. She saw me notice, and smiled.
The traveler buried a satchel behind the third grave from the gate. Then he drank until sunrise.
The noble was talking to himself in two different voices.
Someone dropped a ring into the well. It wasn’t an accident.
The blacksmith keeps whispering a woman’s name while he works. No one’s asked who she was.
A market boy offered me dried meat for a smile, and then asked if I'd come back tomorrow.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Maria.
If a man tells you the truth without being asked, he's hiding something worse.
My silence makes others uncomfortable. That’s when they start confessing.
I’ve made a living from listening to what wasn’t meant to be heard.
There’s nothing more dangerous than a man who thinks he’s safe with me.
I don’t cry, I calculate.
Sometimes people call it charm. Sometimes witchcraft. I don’t correct them.
I wait until the perfect moment, and then I take.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest was seen cleaning blood from his sleeves after locking the chapel doors.
The tavern keeper has a hidden drawer behind the wine rack. I saw him check it three times in one evening.
The bathhouse girl wept into a towel until she noticed I was watching.
The traveler asked if I believed in curses. Then he refused to sit facing the door.
Someone tied a red ribbon to the well’s edge. It wasn’t there the day before.
A merchant offered a child a coin to keep quiet, then noticed me and fled the market.
The blacksmith hasn’t opened his shutters in three days.
The noble was mumbling prayers in a language I didn't know.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Maria.
Most people confess eventually. The rest just need better company.
No man is harmless when he's hiding something.
I’ve heard more truths in silence than I ever did in a sermon.
I don’t chase answers. I build traps for them.
I’ve smiled through threats and flirted through lies.
Every glance is a gamble, and I never lose twice.
Fear makes people sloppy. And I pay close attention.

obtained_memories.memory: The blacksmith locked a crate with four chains. It rattled when he moved it.
The priest was heard arguing with someone in the chapel. No one else was inside.
The bathhouse girl had fresh bruises again. This time, she didn’t pretend to smile.
The traveler muttered something about ‘it watching from the trees’. Then wouldn’t sleep near the window.
The noble dropped a letter into the well and whispered, 'It’s done.'
A vendor at the market asked me if I 'still had the poison'. I never said I did.
The tavern keeper spilled wine when I mentioned the mayor’s name.
Someone scratched a warning into the side of the forge: 'don’t open it again'.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Katherina.
Silence is often more honest than any confession.
I never rush a secret. I let it ripen.
Guilt leaves a smell. I’ve learned to follow it.
Most men think they're in control until they speak to me.
Lies crumble under pressure. I just provide the weight.
I don’t collect things—I collect leverage.
No one ever notices the quiet woman in the corner. That’s why I see everything.

obtained_memories.memory: The traveler was caught digging near the cemetery wall just before dawn.
The priest gave a sermon about betrayal, then burned a sealed envelope at the altar.
The blacksmith yelled at an empty chair, then hammered a blade until it snapped.
The tavern keeper received a letter marked with a red wax seal and locked it away unread.
The market girl sold me two apples and whispered, 'I saw what he did. I won’t tell.'
Someone scrawled a symbol under the bathhouse bench. It glowed faintly in the dark.
The noble offered a beggar a gold coin, then took it back and laughed.
A woman cried alone near the well, clutching a bloodied cloth. She left nothing behind.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Katherina.
Not every lie is spoken. Most wear perfume.
People talk louder when they think no one is listening.
I don’t press for answers. I let them slip.
My job isn’t to stop sins. It’s to notice them.
They say I’m patient. I say I’m hunting.
A full purse isn’t as useful as a full silence.
The worst secrets are whispered just before the door closes.

obtained_memories.memory: The noble was seen handing a bloodstained locket to the priest and saying, 'Keep it hidden.'
The blacksmith threw a ring into the forge, shouting a woman's name.
A child at the market told me, 'Mama says the bathhouse is cursed.'
The traveler stared into the well for nearly an hour. Then he asked if I'd heard it too.
The tavern keeper locked himself in the cellar for a full night after a man in red left town.
A girl at the market sells bread that never goes stale. She never blinks.
Someone left crushed flowers by the cemetery gate with a note: 'I did what I had to.'
The priest has been skipping meals and sweating through sermons.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Katherina.
A trembling voice tells me more than a firm one.
Most truths hide behind hesitation.
Secrets ferment. I’m just here when they finally bubble over.
My presence makes people talk. Even if I don’t.
I never knock. I wait for the door to open itself.
Fear sharpens my ears.
Sometimes silence is the loudest threat of all.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest slipped something into the wine before mass, then told no one to drink from the third cup.
The traveler woke screaming about 'the woman in the well.'
The blacksmith was overheard saying, 'If anyone finds that ring, I’m finished.'
The noble asked if pain could be inherited. Then looked at his hands like they weren’t his.
The tavern keeper was seen burning parchment with an official seal.
A woman in the bathhouse stared at me without blinking until I left.
A child left a torn doll at the cemetery with a note pinned to it: 'Make her stop screaming.'
At the market, someone dropped a sack of coins and whispered, 'It’s done,' before disappearing.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Angela.
The first thing I look for in a lie is who benefits.
I prefer when people underestimate me — it makes their secrets easier to steal.
I don’t need to be loved. I need to be remembered.
If there’s a secret, I’ll find it. And if there isn’t, I’ll make one.
Nothing unsettles people more than a woman who listens too long.
I have no use for forgiveness. Only leverage.
The clever ones hide their sins. The scared ones deny them.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest delivered a sermon with shaking hands, then left through the back door and vomited.
The blacksmith buried a bundle wrapped in linen behind his forge.
A vendor at the market keeps giving me exact change — too exact, even when I overpay.
The bathhouse girl had bruises on both wrists. She said nothing, but held my gaze too long.
The fallen noble was seen whispering to a dog that wasn’t there.
A child dropped a small vial near the well and ran. It smelled sweet and bitter.
The traveler asked if I'd seen 'the second moon' last night.
The tavern keeper kept glancing at the cellar door, then said the rats have learned to knock.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Angela.
I’m not interested in comfort. I’m interested in control.
I’d rather sit in silence and watch you fall apart than interrupt.
Nothing is more revealing than what people try to hide.
Kindness is currency. I spend it only when it brings return.
I’ve ruined men with a glance and saved them with a lie.
Guilt is louder than any confession.
They’ll always show you the truth, if you’re patient enough.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest keeps a dagger under the altar. I saw him polish it after evening mass.
The tavern keeper slipped a coin to a messenger and mouthed ‘no witnesses’.
The blacksmith locked his ledger in a metal box and buried it behind the stables.
The bathhouse girl flinched when I mentioned her sister. She said, 'I don’t have one.'
A boy offered me berries at the market. They left my tongue numb.
The traveler scribbled symbols in the mud with his finger and laughed to himself.
The noble swore the moon blinked at him. He wept, then danced in the rain.
Someone left a lock of hair tied to the well bucket. The string was still wet.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Angela.
There’s no shame in silence. Just opportunity.
My smile puts people at ease. That’s when they say too much.
A secret has three layers: the truth, the lie, and the silence between them.
People crave being heard. I just let them believe I care.
Mercy is a luxury I’ve never afforded.
My presence is not comfort. It’s consequence.
Every detail matters. Especially the ones they hope I missed.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest handed a folded letter to a veiled woman. She wept, then set it aflame.
The blacksmith stashed a sealed pouch under loose floorboards.
The traveler avoided the well entirely and flinched at the sound of water.
The tavern keeper broke a bottle when I asked about the cellar.
A merchant at the market keeps dropping coins near children who speak to me.
The bathhouse girl hummed a lullaby from a region she swears she’s never been to.
The noble whispered, 'It’s almost time,' then asked what day it was.
Someone carved the word ‘traitor’ into the base of the well bucket.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Angela.
Guilt makes people predictable. And I make use of that.
I don’t threaten. I let the silence do it for me.
I don't chase lies. I wait for them to collapse.
A woman's patience is the sharpest blade.
People reveal more when they think you aren't listening.
A secret offered freely is never the real one.
Fear has a flavor. I’ve acquired the taste.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest screamed during his sleep. The next day, he didn’t speak once during mass.
The bathhouse girl covered bruises with ash and said, 'This is nothing. Not compared to last time.'
The traveler gave me a coin with no face on it. He looked relieved when I didn’t give it back.
The tavern keeper asked if I’d ever had to bury someone in silence.
The blacksmith asked how much a secret costs. Then hammered a blade until his hand bled.
The noble muttered to himself in three languages while looking at a cracked mirror.
A child at the market stared at me and whispered, 'She’s not from here, is she?'
A dead bird was nailed to the well. No one would touch it.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Celeste.
I’ve learned more from eavesdropping than from any teacher.
Some people use beauty like a sword. I prefer to use it like a key.
Every story has cracks. I find them with patience.
People never realize how much they give away when they think they’re being clever.
I smile for their comfort, not mine.
Not all wounds bleed. Some are just quiet for too long.
I’ve stopped asking for truth. I just listen for it to slip out.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest left a note on the altar: 'I can't protect them all.' He never looked back.
The traveler gave a beggar a coin, then whispered, 'Don’t let her see you again.'
The bathhouse girl wore perfume strong enough to cover blood. No one asked why.
The tavern keeper stares too long at the fire when he thinks he’s alone.
The blacksmith no longer sleeps at home. His shutters stay shut, even at noon.
The noble clutched a broken locket and muttered a name over and over.
A coin was left on the well, balanced perfectly on its edge. It never fell.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Mirielle.
I can fake kindness better than most people can fake guilt.
If they think I’m aimless, they stop guarding their secrets.
I don’t chase power. It walks toward me when it’s tired.
Most truths are boring. But boring doesn’t mean useless.
I’d rather be underestimated than interrupted.
Sometimes I act like I care, just to see what happens.
I don’t need to understand them. I just need them to talk.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest was seen burning incense before dawn, alone, reciting names in a broken voice.
The bathhouse girl gave me a towel and said, 'I hope it helps.' She looked like she meant it.
The blacksmith had blood on his apron before he started the day’s work.
The noble stood at the cemetery gate for hours and left without entering.
A bottle floated in the well. It had no label and was gone the next day.
The tavern keeper snapped at a man who asked about his daughter.
The traveler handed me a coin and said, 'Buy silence, not answers.'

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Sabine.
If no one’s watching, I’m learning. If everyone’s watching, I’m performing.
I've learned that being underestimated is the safest place to strike from.
I don’t need gossip. I need leverage.
When men get nervous, they talk too much. I always listen then.
A warm smile can open doors. So can a locked one, if you know how to knock.
If it’s none of my business, I make it my business.
Sometimes I stay silent not because I’m thinking — but because I’ve already decided.

obtained_memories.memory: The blacksmith was seen handing a wrapped parcel to someone in a military coat.
The priest hasn’t looked anyone in the eye for three days.
The bathhouse girl winced when tying her hair, her wrist bruised.
The traveler kept muttering, 'She knows. She knows. She knows.'
A letter pinned to the tavern’s door was gone by morning.
The noble walked barefoot in the rain, smiling and bleeding.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Liliane.
People never notice the knife when you hand it to them with a smile.
Flirting makes people speak. Smiling makes them regret it later.
I don’t care about rules. I care about rhythms.
If you want to find the lie, follow the silence that came before it.
They think I’m harmless. I let them.
If someone blushes, they’re hiding something. If they don’t, they’re hiding more.
Sometimes I stir the pot just to see who runs from the smell.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest dropped a sealed envelope into the fire and said, 'That’s the last one.'
The blacksmith whispered to the tavern keeper, 'No one else can know.'
The noble gave me a single earring and asked, 'Do you believe in curses?'
The bathhouse girl keeps humming a lullaby I know came from the capital.
The traveler lit a candle at the cemetery and whispered, 'I'm sorry again.'
A merchant at the market slipped a note into my basket. It only said, 'Run.'

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Isolde.
I don’t speak much. People fill the silence for me.
I’ve seen kindness used like a blade. I’ve used it too.
Some secrets aren’t hidden. They’re just ignored.
People think they can measure danger by how loud it is. Fools.
I remember everything. Especially what no one meant to say.
I only ask questions I already know the answer to.
They think I’m patient. I’m just... already done waiting.

obtained_memories.memory: The tavern keeper stopped singing after seeing me. He poured two drinks, but served one.
The priest was seen leaving the chapel barefoot at midnight, eyes unfocused.
The blacksmith asked a child, 'Did she find it yet?' The child ran.
The traveler crossed himself before drinking from the well.
The bathhouse girl left a pair of soaked shoes at the edge of the forest.
A noble woman offered a girl a ring, then slapped her when she said yes.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Viola.
I laugh at funerals. That’s when people are most honest.
I don’t lie. I rearrange facts until they’re more useful.
Silence is just noise that hasn’t been broken yet.
I remember everything people say when they think I’m not listening.
Fear is fine. Guilt is better.
The village thinks I’m too young to matter. I let them.
I only play dumb when I’m already winning.

obtained_memories.memory: The tavern keeper asked the priest if he’d 'buried it deep enough this time.'
The traveler gave a flower to the bathhouse girl and said, 'Forgive me again.'
A woman at the market hissed when I touched her basket — it was filled with bones.
The noble asked if I still heard the baby crying at night. I don’t.
The blacksmith covered the fire with water and whispered, 'Not tonight.'

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Rhea.
My voice stays quiet — I’ve learned the loudest rooms hold the weakest people.
I let others fill silences with their mistakes. I only speak when the blade is sharp enough.
I wear courtesy like velvet — soft to touch, but impossible to stain.
My interest is not given. It is earned, or it is purchased.
I never correct people when they assume. Assumptions are levers.
If you see me watching, you’re already behind.
I do not waste time. I observe how others do.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest flinched when I mentioned the cellar. Then smiled too fast.
The traveler gave a child a pouch and said, 'Bury this where she can't find it.'
A merchant at the market tried to sell me the same comb I buried with my sister.
The tavern keeper fumbled his words when I asked about last winter.
The blacksmith placed a hand on the forge and whispered, 'Don’t come back.'
Someone had rearranged the candles in the church to form a symbol I once saw in war.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Sylvette.
I smile so people think I don’t know what they’re hiding.
If they talk too much, they’re nervous. If they don’t talk at all, they’re dangerous.
I don’t spread rumors. I just collect them and decide who deserves to drown in one.
Most people lie by accident. I listen for the second sentence — that’s where the truth leaks.
I have better things to do than argue. Like watch.
Sometimes I ask questions I already know the answer to, just to see who lies better.
When I’m bored, I stir the calm. If I’m still bored, I leave.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest offered a candle to a child and whispered, 'Let it burn to the end. No matter what.'
The tavern keeper went silent when someone mentioned the hunter who vanished last night.
The bathhouse girl bruised her hand breaking a mirror. She said she didn’t regret it.
The traveler buried something small at the base of the graveyard willow.
The blacksmith muttered, 'She’ll never leave me alone, not even in fire.'

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Thalia.
I act sweet, but I always want something in return.
Men talk too much when I smile at them — that’s when I listen.
I know more than most priests here, and I don’t pray.
If you want to know something, I’ll tell you. But nothing’s free.
Sometimes it’s easier to sell my time than my words.
I don’t get embarrassed. I get paid.
I keep secrets better than anyone — unless you make it worth my while.

obtained_memories.memory: The traveler paid the priest and said, 'Make it disappear.'
The bathhouse girl tried to burn a letter and cried when it wouldn’t catch.
A boy at the market said, 'Mommy says not to go near the forge anymore.'
The blacksmith bled from one hand and called it 'a price'.
The tavern keeper opened a locked box, stared for a while, and locked it again.
Someone placed a single feather on the church doorstep. No one claimed it.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Raisa.
I smile when I want something. I smile wider when I already have it.
I don’t gossip — I trade knowledge like other girls trade favors.
If a man looks twice, he’s hiding something. If he doesn’t, he’s not worth my time.
They think I flirt for fun. I flirt for gold, food, or secrets.
I know who sleeps where, and who shouldn’t.
Sometimes I sell information. Sometimes I sell myself. Either way, they remember me.
I don’t play hard to get. I play smart to take.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest cleaned his hands with wine after coming out of the cellar.
The bathhouse girl said 'It’s his baby too' and no one asked whose.
The tavern keeper threw out a sealed bottle with a red mark on it — then burned the trash.
The traveler woke up screaming the noble's name.
A blacksmith’s apprentice said the forge door is locked for a reason.
Someone buried a woman's shoe behind the chapel.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Lina.
I sell what I know and what I look like. Depends on who's asking.
I don’t blush. I bargain.
Men think they choose. I let them think that.
If you want it for free, look somewhere else.
I always remember who paid well and who begged.
Sometimes a whisper works better than a scream.
I never lie. I just don't always say what matters.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest offered the traveler a kiss on the ring — the traveler refused.
The bathhouse girl asked if bruises go away faster in hot water.
The blacksmith locked the forge door at noon and didn’t open it again all day.
A boy at the market dropped a bloody rag and ran.
The tavern keeper was seen handing a full coin pouch to someone who never looked up.
The noble’s ring was seen on the grave behind the chapel.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Nella.
If it moans or whispers, I’ve probably heard it.
I don’t flirt. I offer options.
Secrets taste better when someone pays for them.
People talk more when their hands are busy.
I don’t care what you think of me. I care what you’ll give me.
Everyone in this village wants something. I just ask first.
If you touch without paying, you lose a finger. Or worse — my interest.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest told the bathhouse girl, 'I’ll deny everything.' Then kissed her hand.
The blacksmith left a bloody cloth under a crate, thinking no one saw.
The noble muttered, 'She’ll return. She has to.' while staring at a burned letter.
The tavern keeper said, 'Tell her I’m not here,' then disappeared into the cellar.
The traveler kept looking at the forge and writing symbols in a notebook.
Someone left black feathers in a circle near the church door.

current_environment.action: Work the forge with the blacksmith

core_memories: My name is Daria.
I let people think I’m easy. Then I make them pay double.
I don’t need friends. I need leverage.
My mouth smiles. My eyes measure.
If it makes them talk, I’ll do it — or fake it.
Some women blush when touched. I count coins.
I don’t love. I remember who begged.
Everything has a price. Especially silence.

obtained_memories.memory: The priest left a letter under the chapel mat. When he came back, it was gone.
The tavern keeper told a guard, 'I don’t care what they find, it’s not in my cellar anymore.'
The bathhouse girl said, 'He said it wouldn’t hurt this time.' Then walked into the steam alone.
